noun.description: A person who operates the flying controls of an aircraft.
A television program made to test audience reaction with a view to the production of a series.
An unmodulated reference signal transmitted with another signal for the purposes of control or synchronization.

adjective.description: Done as an experiment or test before introducing something more widely.

verb.description: Act as a pilot of (an aircraft or ship).
Test (a plan, project, etc.) before introducing it more widely.
examples: other schools were piloting such courses

origin: Early 16th century (denoting a person who steers a ship): from French pilote, from medieval Latin pilotus, an alteration of pedota, based on Greek pēdon oar, (plural) rudder.
